text: The Indian state Goa is divided into 2 districts: North Goa and South Goa. == Administrative structure == North Goa is further divided into three subdivisions – Panaji, Mapusa, and Bicholim; and five taluks – Tiswadi (Panaji), Bardez (Mapusa), Pernem, Bicholim, and Sattari (Valpoi), South Goa is further divided into five subdivisions – Ponda, Mormugao (Vasco da Gama), Margao, Quepem, and Dharbandora; and seven taluks – Ponda, Mormugao, Salcete (Margao), Quepem, and Canacona (Chaudi), Sanguem, and Dharbandora. (Ponda Taluka shifted from North Goa to South Goa in January 2015). ==Alphabetical listing== Code District Headquarters Population (2011) Area (km²) Density (/km²) Official website NG North Goa district Panaji 817,761 1,736 471 http://northgoa.nic.in/ SG South Goa district Margao 639,962 1,966 326 http://southgoa.nic.in/ ==References== *
title: List of districts of Goa
